title: 105_s1277
content: Designation of overpayments and contributions for the benefit of units of the National Park System is added as a new part in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. This includes Section 6097 which outlines the designation process. Individual taxpayers can designate a portion of their overpayment of tax and any cash contribution on their tax return to benefit units of the National Park System. This designation must be made at the time of filing the tax return and will be treated as a refund to the taxpayer. The date prescribed for filing tax returns under chapter 1 is determined without extensions or, if later, the actual filing date. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 1997. The National Parks Trust Fund is established under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The National Parks Trust Fund is created in the Treasury of the United States to fund park facilities' design, construction, rehabilitation, and repair. The fund receives appropriations and transfers from designated amounts under section 6097. The Secretary pays the National Park Service from the fund for enhancing park visitor experiences. The National Parks Trust Fund is used for park projects and administrative expenses, not land acquisition. A study on the program's effects will be submitted to Congress within 2 years of enactment. The National Parks Trust Fund is used for park projects and administrative expenses, with a study on the program's effects to be submitted to Congress within 2 years of enactment. The Secretary may provide additional information for evaluating the program's effectiveness. Sec. 9512. National Parks Trust Fund.
